intro: Amsinckia rostellata, commonly known as the desert flax, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features gray-green, hairy leaves and produces striking yellow flowers with a distinctive, elongated lower petal. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is adapted to thrive in dry, well-drained soils. Amsinckia rostellata is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
